snippet: Mutations in the PALB2 gene raise risk in women by almost as much as mutations in BRCA1 and BRCA2, the genes implicated in most inherited cases.
abstract: Study in the New England Journal of Medicine finds that mutations in a gene called PALB2 raise the risk of breast cancer in women by almost as much as mutations in BRCA1 and BRCA2, genes that have long been implicated in most inherited cases of the disease.
lead_paragraph: Mutations in the PALB2 gene raise risk in women by almost as much as mutations in BRCA1 and BRCA2, the genes implicated in most inherited cases.

headline.main: Study Shows Third Gene as Indicator for Breast Cancer
headline.print_headline: Study Shows Third Gene as Indicator for Cancer
